sentences.english: His eyes gleamed with relief and joy.
sentences.chinese: 他两眼露出宽慰和喜悦的光芒。

sentences.english: When it came to the turn of a male singer I was considerably relieved.
sentences.chinese: 轮到男歌手开始唱时，我才觉得宽慰多了。

sentences.english: Victory in the heart very relieved, encourage GuanWenJun to pursue their own happiness.
sentences.chinese: 胜利心中十分宽慰，鼓励管文军追求自己的幸福。

sentences.english: None of this is much solace to Danone.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都并不能让达能感到宽慰。

sentences.english: Yet tonight, we take comfort in knowing that the tide of war is receding.
sentences.chinese: 不过今晚，让我们宽慰的是，战争的浪潮正在消退。

sentences.english: Uncle Homayoun held her by the shoulders in an attempt to comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 荷马扬叔叔搂着她的肩试图宽慰她。

sentences.english: Lies when all comfort, warmth even more false I also relieved.
sentences.chinese: 谎言全当安慰，多些温情即便虚假我也宽慰。

sentences.english: Also, a hot shower can be one of the most soothing experiences early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 同样，在早晨一个热水澡是最宽慰的体验。

sentences.english: I sighed in relief , and continued with the psychoanalysis.
sentences.chinese: 我宽慰地松了口气，然后继续接受他的心理分析。

sentences.english: He heaved a sigh of relief when he found his son in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 当他在森林中找到儿子时，他宽慰地松了一口气。

sentences.english: See ray of light in through the sects, he was relieved.
sentences.chinese: 看到门下透进一丝光芒，他感到宽慰。

sentences.english: Lily is my only love, whose coolness and elegance conciliate my soul.
sentences.chinese: 我独爱着百合，她的淡雅她的清凉宽慰我心灵。

sentences.english: May a kind of world, a reassuring touch, a warm smile be yours every day of your life.
sentences.chinese: 愿宽慰善言，舒心触抚，暖意笑容与君相随每一天。

sentences.english: The next generation is only comforts to own one kind.
sentences.chinese: 下辈子只是自己对自己的一种宽慰罢了。

sentences.english: Moreover, Xiao Yang, also my mother"s relief fraud in good faith."
sentences.chinese: 不仅如此，肖扬还善意地骗取妈妈的宽慰。
神圣的静寂和宽慰慢慢沉落。

definition: to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
to comfort oneself/to console oneself/to reassure oneself
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
